questions.question: I …………………….. an interesting novel now.
questions.description: We use the present continuous here because the time expression now gives the indication that we are talking about the present.

questions.question: She ………………………. with her parents at the moment.
This time tomorrow we ………………………. Raj’s birthday.
questions.description: We use the future continuous here because we are talking about an action or situation that will be in progress at a particular point of time in future.

questions.question: The child ………………………… for his parents.
questions.description: There is no time reference here hence the present continuous is used.

questions.question: I ……………………… ready when she came.
questions.description: The past tense in the subordinate clause clearly indicates that we are talking about past time.

questions.question: He ………………………… in the afternoon.
questions.description: The present continuous can be used to talk about future events if the arrangement already exists. The future continuous is also possible here.

questions.question: I ……………………… when the lights went out.
questions.description: The past tense in the subordinate clause clearly indicates that we are talking about past time.

questions.question: The boys ………………………. in the park when it started raining.
questions.description: The past tense in the subordinate clause clearly indicates that we are talking about past time.

questions.question: We …………………… to Mexico next summer.
questions.description: The present continuous can be used to talk about future events if the arrangement already exists. The future continuous is also possible here.

questions.question: The car …………………… for a service next week.
Don’t phone them now – they ……………………. dinner.
questions.description: The future continuous is often used to predict the present.
